title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
I have this board that doesn't look to have any liquid damage and is stuck at 5v and 0.21amps on all 4 ports. There isn't any boot loop just a steady 5v. I was getting 1.4v on PP3v3_G3H and so far I have replaced U6903, R6910-13, C6910/11/13/15/16 and D6902 . 

I still get the same voltage but I noticed when I remove R6915 from the board I get 3.39v on PP3v3_G3H but I still get 5v on the charger but 0amps this time. When I put R6915 back on it goes to the original issue. 

I visually inspected all the CD3215 chips and there doesn't look to be any damage to any of them or around them.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message: Check diode mode to ground on the 4 LDOs of each CD3215 chip.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
The values look good.
You should have a problem with other chip connected to 3V3_G3H.
Post diode mode to ground at C6920.
Injecting 3.5V there may help to find something with a good IR camera.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
Okay I injected voltage and found that CB300 was getting really hot. I replaced that and now it turns on the trackpad clicks, I hear the apple sound that happens when you plug your charger in and the caps lock button turns green when pressed. The only thing is nothing appears on the screen.

Where do you first check for screen issues?

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message: Check external monitor and USB activity.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message: I get a light on my usb stick I plug in but there is no image or anything from an external tv plugged in.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
Need to see flashing Link LED for boot pendrive.
Only then you have USB activity confirmed.

Caps Lock key reacts every time?

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message: Yes I have a flashing link LED and yes the caps lock key reacts everytime.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
In this case, the board is active.

Looks like integrated Intel graphics is bad.
Compare diode mode readings on EDP_INT_x lines with good board.

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message: I don't have another board to measure against but I plugged in another display assembly I know worked in the past and that didn't work. This time i also saw ESC light appear on the touchbar

title: 820-00239 Stuck at 5v - PP3v3_G3H at 1.4v
message:
You can compare diode mode readings between data lines of similar pair.
One data pair should have same value on its data lines.
